tr.td:
Dear Dr. O'Reilly,
I had the pleasure of meeting Mr. Linacre at the Community Nutrition and Dietetics outpatient clinic on 1 May 2017, referred by Sugra Bibi, Hospital dietician at St Crispin's Hospital, Donaldstown, DO5 7TP.
Appointment to be made at a later date

td.p: Organisation: Dietetics Department, St. Crispin's Hospital, Donaldstown, DO5 7TP

tr.td: Following a stroke Mr. Linacre experienced acquired swallowing difficulties.

tr.th: History of each presenting complaint or issue
tr.td: Mr. Linacre attended the community nutrition and dietetics outpatient clinic for review of feeding. During a recent admission to hospital Mr. Linacre was established on PEG tube feeding. The feeding tube insitu is a 15French PEG tube placed 05/04/17.

Mr. Linacre's feeding regimen being: 1000mls Energy Multifibre Feed at 100mls/hours for 10 hours (9am-7pm) with 1400mls water given as divided flushes (e.g. 10x140mls) throughout the day e.g. before and after feed and with medications. His weight is stable. Mr. Linacre has tolerated the regimen well.
The estimated nutritional requirements for Mr. Linacre are Energy 1500kcla/day, Protein 80g/day, Fluid 2400mls/day.
Mr. Linacre is tolerating his feed and fluid flushes well as per his feeding regimen and he reports being compliant with his medication.
Mr. Linacre's peg site has healed and was clean and dry and exposed on assessment.
Mr. Linacre's bowels are opening daily (with no bowel meds), all pressure areas are intact and his weight is stable.
No known allergies or adverse reactions
(only changes to medications and medical devices as a result of the outpatient encounter are included)
Mr. Linacre needs 100ml/day of energy fibre feed given via PEG tube over 10hrs (10am-7pm)
Please prescribe 28 x 100ml bags per month. Prescription to be sent directly to the feed company who will deliver direct to patient.
Divided flushes (e.g. 10x140mls) throughout the day e.g. before and after feed and with medications.
Mr. Linacre has been supplied with a feeding pump.

A backpack has been ordered (05/05/17) so that Mr. Linacre can feed when he goes out during the day as he did not like feeding during the night when he was in hospital and feels restricted to stay at home at the moment.
Person Responsible: Susan Blight - Community Dietitian, Adobe Health Centre Community Dietetics Department.
Action status: Completed
Follow-up via telephone within 1 month.
Person Responsible: Susan Blight - Community Dietitian, Adobe Health Centre Community Dietetics Department.
Action status: Requested
Please prescribe 28 x 100ml bags per month. Prescription to be sent directly to the feed company who will deliver direct to patient.
Person Responsible: Dr. C. O'Reilly - GP, Canvas Health Centre.
Action status: Requested
Feeding Company Nurse has been requested (05/05/17) to train Mr. Linacre on use of pump.
Person Responsible: Doug Sway - Feeding nurse, Company X.
Action status: Requested

tr.th: Actions for patient or their carer
tr.td: Mr. Linacre has been asked to continue on feeding regime.
Mr. Linacre was given the clinic contact details and a copy of his feeding regime with Trust guidance.

text.value: 1000mls Energy Multifibre Feed at 100mls/hours for 10 hours (9am-7pm)
1400mls water given as divided flushes (e.g. 10x140mls) throughout the day e.g. before and after feed and with medications.
100mls Energy Multifibre Feed at 100mls/day over 10 hours (9am-7pm)
No known allergies or adverse reactions

name.value: Community Nutrition and Dietetics Outpatient Clinic
